identificationModule.briefTitle: Antibiotic Exposure During Pregnancy Affects Infant Gut Microbiota
identificationModule.officialTitle: Antibiotic Exposure During Pregnancy Affects Infant Gut Microbiota

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Based on a prospective birth cohort, we will collect biological samples from pregnant women and newborns to measure the gut microbial diversity and metabolites of newborns. These results systematically evaluate the effects of antibiotic exposure on the structure and function of gut microbiota. The project can reveal the effects of antibiotic exposure on the growth and development of gut microbiota in early life.

armGroups.label: Mother-infant cohort with antibiotic treatment group

interventions.name: antibiotic treatment
interventions.description: AT: Mother-infant cohort with antibiotic treatment group CS: Mother-infant cohort (Prophylactic antibiotics therapy) ND: Mother-infant cohort (Natural delivery)
armGroupLabels: Mother-infant cohort with antibiotic treatment group

primaryOutcomes.measure: antibiotic exposure affecting the infant gut microbiome
primaryOutcomes.description: antibiotic treatment; the structure and function of gut microbiota
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Pregnancy (12, 24, 37 weeks) and infants (born, 1 week, and 1, 3, 6, 12 months)
